title: PTGui Pro 9.2.0 Retail (Mac OSX)
description:
PTGui is panoramic stitching software for Windows and Mac OSX. Originally developed as a Graphical User Interface for Panorama Tools (hence the name), PTGui now is a full featured photo stitching application.

Features:

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ PTGui can stitch multiple rows of images

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ No need to keep the camera level: PTGui can stitch rotated and tilted images
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Virtually unlimited output size: create Gigapixel panoramas from hundreds of images!
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Layered output allows full control over the final stitched result
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ PTGui stitches most panoramas fully automatically, but at the same time provides full manual control over every single parameter. This enables stitching of Ã¢â‚¬ËœdifficultÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ scenes, where other programs fail.
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Full 16 bit workflow for best image quality
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Automatic stitching: create panoramas with just a few mouse clicks
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Manual mode: full control over the final result
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Live preview: instantly see the effect of different settings, without the need to stitch first
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Multi row panoramas: images can be stacked both horizontally and vertically
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Stitch rotated and tilted images
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Create HUGE panoramas: stitch hundreds of images into a gigapixel panorama
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Support for jpeg, tiff and png source images
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Create panoramas in jpeg, tiff or Photoshop format
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Photoshop large document (.psb) support
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Layered Photoshop output, ideal for retouching
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Full support for 16 bit images, for the best image quality
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Panorama editor: interactive adjustment of the panorama perspective
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Create templates with frequently used settings
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ QTVR ouput: directly create a QTVR panorama in PTGui, or convert an existing panorama into QTVR format
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Batch stitcher: prepare any number of panoramas and stitch them later without user intervention.
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Support for multiple processors / multiple core computers
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Stitch and blend HDR source images into an HDR panorama
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Stitch and blend bracketed LDR source images into an HDR panorama
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Calculate camera response curve from bracketed LDR source images
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Built in tone mapper
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Support for OpenEXR (.exr) and HDR Radiance (.hdr) source images
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Blend Priority parameter (useful for blending the nadir image in a spherical panorama)
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Viewpoint correction
